nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
# Create Google Drive Folders by Path
This workflow created nested Google Drive folder from a path string and returns the ID of the final folder for immediate use.

Use this workflow in your other flows by calling it directly with the following data:
- `google_drive_folder_id` -> The ID of the folder where you want to create additional folders in. You can use "root" if you want to begin at root level of your Drive.
- `desired_path` -> The folder structure you'd like to create in Google Drive. Each folder is separated by a slash, eg: `Projects/Clients/Reports`

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
## Test data for the workflow
Use this in case you want to test the workflow.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
## Triggered from another workflow
This workflow is intended to be triggered by other workflows. Don't copy/paste this workflow as it will be more difficult to maintain and keep up-to-date.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note3

parameters.content:
## Main loop
Take the desired_path and split it into parts. Eg: `Projects/Clients/Reports` will turn into 3 parts: Projects, Clients, Reports.
We then check if the top folder exists and create it if not. We repeat this process until all subfolders have been created and correctly nested.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note4

parameters.content:
## Rerturn data
Here we return the ID of the last folder in the path, so you can start uploading new files to it.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Manualtrigger Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Manualtrigger Workflow. This workflow integrates 8 different services: stickyNote, code, googleDrive, set, stopAndError. It contains 18 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 18
- **Node Types**: 8
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **When clicking ‘Test workflow’**: manualTrigger
- **Set parameters for next run**: code
- **Execute Workflow Trigger**: executeWorkflowTrigger
- **Dummy input data**: set
- **Split the desired path**: code
- **Create desired path**: code
- **Check if top folder exists**: googleDrive
- **If top folder doesn't exist**: if
- **Create new subfolder**: googleDrive
- **If path has been completely created**: if
- ... and 8 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.
